properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A period of extreme cold with wind chill values of approximately minus 52 is occurring. Conditions will improve today. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-01T01:04:35-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-28T16:19:35-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1734571380.2021
Area: Salluit, Kangiqsujuaq - Raglan Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for today. Snowfall with total amounts of 5 to 10 cm is expected. Snow, at times heavy, will affect the area beginning late this morning or early afternoon. Additionally, strong northwest winds gusting up to 60 km/h will develop this evening creating localized areas of blowing snow. Dangerous winter driving conditions due to heavy snow and blowing snow are expected. Be prepared to adjust your driving with the changing road conditions. Conditions are expected to improve by late this evening. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-01T05:03:54-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-28T13:04:54-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4000868883.2021
Area: Marathon - Schreiber

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Extreme cold wind chill values between minus 50 and minus 55 continue. Conditions will moderate this afternoon for southern parts of the territory but are expected to persist into Monday for areas in the north. ### Watch for cold related symptoms: shortness of breath, chest pain, muscle pain and weakness, numbness and colour change in fingers and toes. Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-01T09:10:14-00:00

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions will continue until this evening. ### Travel is expected to be extremely hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-01T04:59:40-00:00

Area: Cambridge Bay

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong southerly winds will stir up the snow and give blizzard conditions over this community until late in the day. A blizzard warning is issued when winds are expected to produce blowing snow with widespread visibilities of 400 metres or less for at least 6 hours. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Potentially damaging winds tonight and Monday. Strong west to northwesterly winds gusting up to 90 km/h are forecast to develop this evening along the shores of Lake Huron and Georgian Bay. Winds will likely diminish slightly Monday morning but will strengthen again Monday afternoon. Gusts up to 90 km/h will be possible Monday afternoon. The winds are forecast to diminish Monday evening. Power outages are possible. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-01T07:49:42-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-28T15:50:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2709964953.2021

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blowing snow beginning Monday evening. Snowfall amounts of 10 to 15 cm, strong winds and blowing snow are expected Monday and Tuesday. The snow will intensify Monday morning. Then, late in the day, winds will develop and temperatures will fall dramatically overnight Monday to Tuesday causing blowing snow. Hazardous driving conditions are expected due to low to zero visibilities. Quickly accumulating snow could make travel difficult. Consider modifying any non-essential travel plans. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-01T09:04:55-00:00

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: High southerly winds will reach up to 100 kilometres per hour and ease late in the day. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.

properties.Title: Flash Freeze Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: From late overnight through early Monday morning, the arrival of an Arctic air mass will cause temperatures to fall dramatically, from near zero to minus 16 degrees Celsius in a few hours. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds tonight and Monday. Strong northwest winds gusting up to 90 km/h are forecast to develop late this evening near and along the shorelines of Whitefish Bay and northern Lake Huron. Winds will then diminish slightly overnight but will strengthen again Monday morning. Gusts up to 80 km/h will be possible again Monday morning into the early afternoon. The winds will diminish Monday evening. Power outages are possible. ### High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Flash Freeze Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Temperatures are expected to climb above the zero degree celsius mark today accompanied by rain or wet snow. Temperatures will then fall rapidly with the passage of a cold front near or after midnight. Ponding water, slush, and any falling precipitation will freeze as the temperature drops. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Travel may be hazardous due to sudden changes in the weather. Flash freeze warnings are issued when a rapid drop in temperature is expected, that can cause water from rain or melted snow on streets and sidewalks to quickly freeze. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-01T01:14:55-00:00

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility in blowing snow are expected or occurring. A low in the northern Gulf of Alaska and high pressure over the Northwest Territories are combining to produce a strong pressure gradient over the Dempster highway. Easterly winds to 80 km/h gusting to 100 near the Richardson Mountains are giving blizzard conditions. Winds are forecast to ease tonight. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-28T23:59:06-00:00

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 25 cm is expected. Time span: Monday morning until Tuesday morning. Locations: northern New Brunswick Remarks: snow, heavy at times, will spread eastward across northern New Brunswick beginning early Monday morning. Temperatures will rise above zero in some places Monday afternoon which will cause partial melting of the snow as it falls, which could make it heavy to move. Snow tapers to flurries Tuesday morning then strong northerlies develop which ushers in a very cold airmass. Some blowing snow is possible on Tuesday morning. ### Rapidly accumulating snow will make travel difficult. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning Ended
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are no longer expected to reach extreme cold warning criteria. However, some areas may briefly experience extreme cold wind chill values near minus 45 again tonight before temperatures rise on Monday. ###
Expires: 2021-02-28T19:28:23-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-28T18:29:23-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1235871925.2021
Area: Uranium City - Camsell Portage, Fond-du-Lac, Stony Rapids and Black Lake, Cree Lake - Key Lake, Wollaston Lake - Collins Bay, Southend - Brabant Lake - Kinoosao
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of about 15 cm is expected. A strong Pacific front continues to give heavy snowfall to the region. The snow will ease near midday as the front moves to the east. ### Rapidly accumulating snow will make travel difficult. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-28T21:54:46-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-28T13:05:46-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2014688440.2021
Area: Cassiar Mountains
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of about 15 cm is expected. Snow, at times heavy, will affect the Moosonee area beginning late this afternoon. Additionally, strong northwest winds gusting up to 60 km/h will develop this evening creating localized areas of blowing snow. Conditions are expected to improve by Monday morning. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-01T06:10:55-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-28T14:11:55-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1537336743.2021
Area: Moosonee
properties.Author: Environment Canada
